bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Daniel Kirke Hall was a Union officer, 12th Vermont Infantry Regiment during the Civil War. He later served in the Third Brigade of the Third Division of the First Army Corps; the Department of the Gulf (later the Military Division of West Mississippi); the Fourth Brigade, Reserve Corps; and the 13th Army Corps. He was originally from Pittsford (Rutland Co.), Vt. Hall married Mattie A. Wheaton on January 6, 1867, and settled on his family's homestead.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Papers relating to Hall's service in the 12th Vermont Infantry and as a captain and commissary of the Subsistance Department in the U.S. Army. Contains permits to travel, passes, and orders and many items concerning the Subsistence Department including special and general orders pertaining to instructions for rations of food and related supplies. Generals issuing the orders include Elias S. Dennis, Amos B. Eaton, George Francis McGinnis, and Edward R. S. Canby.
